CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper July 17, 1965, pg. 16, reads: "Principals and Star - Among the principals who help Cab Calloway, star of the Civic Light Opera's current production, 'Porgy and Bess,' make the show a success, are those above. Left to right: Helen Dowdy, the original 'Strawberry Woman'; Dolores Ivory, Cab Calloway, the marvelous 'Sportin' Life'; Martha Flowers, the beautiful 'Bess'; Catherine Eason, the poignant 'Clara,' and an alternate 'Bess,' and Gordon Watkins, who plays Clara's husband, 'Jake.' Not pictured are LeVern Hutcherson, who has the title role of 'Porgy'; John McCurry, the realistic 'Crown,' and one of the show's great performers, Carol Brice, who almost steals the show with her 'Maria.' Beautiful sets and the many beautiful songs make the folk opera a MUST for theatre-goers. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Civic Light Opera's "Porgy and Bess" cast members Helen Dowdy, Dolores Ivory, Cab Calloway, Martha Flowers, Catherine Eason, and Gordon Watkins posed backstage at Civic Arena
